service1.title: SLM Best Practices
service1.description: Localization, field implementation, and documentation of international SLM best practices, particularly those from WOCAT (the World Overview of Conservation Approaches and Technologies).

service2.title: Capacity Building
service2.description: Capacity building for local communities, herders, women, and youth, including trainings, hands-on demonstrations, and participatory monitoring.

service3.title: Multi-Stakeholder Cooperation
service3.description: Supporting multi-stakeholder cooperation in land restoration, ecosystem protection, and rangeland management.

Home-About.title: About GMH
Home-About.description: Green Mongolia Hub NGO was established in 2024 as a legally registered civil society organization under the laws of Mongolia. The organization is accredited to the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD) and is a member of both the WOCAT Global SLM Network and the Drynet Network for Land Degradation Neutrality (LDN). The organization works at the intersection of science, community empowerment, and policy advocacy, focusing on sustainable land management, rangeland restoration, climate resilience, and youth engagement.

About-About.title: About GMH
About-About.description: Green Mongolia Hub integrates scientific knowledge, international networks, and local experience to address Mongolia's land degradation challenges through socially, environmentally, and economically interconnected solutions.
fields: Localization, field implementation, and documentation of international SLM best practices, particularly those from WOCAT (the World Overview of Conservation Approaches and Technologies— the global database for land conservation methods and technologies).
Capacity building for local communities, herders, women, and youth, including trainings, hands-on demonstrations, and participatory monitoring.
Supporting multi-stakeholder cooperation in land restoration, ecosystem protection, and rangeland management.
Promoting Mongolia's good practices through global platforms such as UNCCD, WOCAT, and Drynet, and increasing civil society engagement in policy development.
Advancing nature-based solutions and green technologies that reinforce local development and environmental sustainability.

About.title: About GMH
About.description: Green Mongolia Hub NGO was established in 2024 as a legally registered civil society organization under the laws of Mongolia. The organization is accredited to the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD) and is a member of both the WOCAT Global SLM Network and the Drynet Network for Land Degradation Neutrality (LDN).

achievement1.description: Accredited to the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification, enabling participation in global policy processes.

achievement2.title: WOCAT Member

BoardOfAdvisors.title: Board of Advisors
BoardOfAdvisors.description: The Board of Advisors provides strategic leadership, oversight, and guidance to Green Mongolia Hub, ensuring alignment with UN and donor standards.

responsibilities.description1: Guiding the organization's long-term vision and partnerships.
responsibilities.description3: Ensuring sound project implementation and financial management.
responsibilities.description4: Upholding transparency, integrity, and responsible organizational practices.

Careers.title: Careers
Careers.description: Join Green Mongolia Hub and contribute to sustainable land management, community empowerment, and environmental protection in Mongolia.
Careers.positionsDescription: We are looking for passionate individuals to join our team and make a difference in Mongolia's environmental future.

position1.title: SLM Technical Expert
position1.description: Expert in sustainable land management practices and WOCAT methodologies.

position2.title: Community Engagement Specialist
position2.description: Specialist in community capacity building and participatory approaches.

position3.title: Project Coordinator
position3.description: Coordinate field projects and manage stakeholder relationships.

position4.title: MEL Specialist
position4.description: Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning specialist for project impact assessment.

Careers.whyJoinDescription: Green Mongolia Hub offers a dynamic work environment with opportunities for professional growth and meaningful impact.

UNPartners.title: UNCCD Partnership
UNPartners.lead: Green Mongolia Hub NGO is accredited to the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD) and actively participates in major international climate and land governance processes.
UNPartners.cop29: UNFCCC COP29 - Participated as part of Mongolia's official delegation, representing Mongolian civil society
UNPartners.cric23: UNCCD CRIC23 - Participated in the Committee for the Review of the Implementation of the Convention in Panama, representing Mongolian civil society
UNPartners.contributionsDesc: Through these activities, Green Mongolia Hub has:
UNPartners.contribution1: Raised Mongolia's rangeland degradation, water scarcity, and land degradation issues at the international level
UNPartners.contribution2: Directly integrated herders' and local communities' needs, priorities, and field experiences into policy discussions
UNPartners.contribution3: Served as a bridge "from field to policy," ensuring grassroots realities are reflected in global decision-making
UNPartners.contribution4: Become a member of Mongolia's National Carbon Market Working Group
UNPartners.contribution5: Participated in several technical sub-working groups preparing for UNCCD COP17 (2026, Ulaanbaatar)
UNPartners.wocatDesc: As an official member of WOCAT (World Overview of Conservation Approaches and Technologies), Green Mongolia Hub contributes to strengthening SLM practices in Mongolia.
UNPartners.wocatActivity1: Localizing, translating, and applying WOCAT methodologies and evaluation systems to Mongolian conditions
UNPartners.wocatActivity2: Using WOCAT evaluation and documentation tools at the soum and local levels
UNPartners.wocatActivity3: Preparing to register good practices implemented in Mongolia in WOCAT's global SLM knowledge database
UNPartners.wocatFieldDesc: Green Mongolia Hub's field experiences, including wind protection belts, afforestation seedling nurseries, and protection zones implemented in Javkhlant soum, can be fully documented and registered in WOCAT's global knowledge database.
UNPartners.drynetDesc: In 2024-2025, Green Mongolia Hub participated in Drynet's global programs:
UNPartners.drynetCapacityDesc: Through these programs, Green Mongolia Hub has gained practical experience and implementable methodologies in:
UNPartners.drynetCapacity1: Methods for local participation and inclusion of vulnerable groups
UNPartners.drynetCapacity2: Civil society governance and institutional capacity
UNPartners.drynetCapacity3: Mechanisms for incorporating local voices into national and international decision-making
UNPartners.drynetCapacity4: Land Degradation Neutrality (LDN) goals and approaches for accessible land governance impact
UNPartners.drynetResult: This participation has significantly strengthened Green Mongolia Hub's capacity to mobilize communities and integrate their positions into policy, project, and program levels.
UNPartners.unccdAccreditedDesc: Accredited civil society organization under the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification
UNPartners.wocatMemberDesc: Member of the WOCAT Global Sustainable Land Management Network
UNPartners.drynetMemberDesc: Member of the Drynet Network for Land Degradation Neutrality (LDN)
UNPartners.cop17SupportDesc: Participating in technical sub-working groups for UNCCD COP17 (2026, Ulaanbaatar)

LocalPartners.title: Billion Tree Fund Partnership
LocalPartners.lead: Green Mongolia Hub, an accredited civil society organization under the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD), has entered into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Billion Tree Fund.
LocalPartners.partnershipDesc: The Memorandum of Understanding was signed by:
LocalPartners.signatory1: Ms. B. Bayarmaa, Executive Director of the Billion Tree Fund
LocalPartners.signatory2: Ms. Ts. Mandukhai, Executive Director of Arvis Green Mongolia NGO (Green Mongolia Hub)
LocalPartners.cooperationDesc: Within the framework of this cooperation, Green Mongolia Hub, in its capacity as a UNCCD-accredited civil society organization, will contribute by:
LocalPartners.cooperation1: Facilitating the transfer and localization of international knowledge, experience, and lessons learned in Mongolia
LocalPartners.cooperation2: Promoting cross-country cooperation and exchange of experience
LocalPartners.cooperation3: Providing analytical inputs, reports, and policy-level information, as appropriate
LocalPartners.jointProjectsDesc: Under the MoU, the parties have agreed to cooperate in the implementation of projects and programs aimed at:
LocalPartners.jointProject1: Making a substantive contribution to the national "One Billion Trees" movement initiated by the President of Mongolia
LocalPartners.jointProject2: Attracting international investment to the forestry sector
LocalPartners.jointProject3: Strengthening the capacity of forestry professionals
LocalPartners.resultFinancingDesc: As part of the cooperation, result-based financing approaches will be explored for projects and programs in the areas of:
LocalPartners.forestCarbonDesc: Within the framework of the One Billion Trees national movement, the parties will support the participation of relevant stakeholders in forest carbon programs as a means of meeting equivalent conservation or protection commitments, while working to ensure that tangible outcomes are monitored and verified over the long term.
LocalPartners.otherPartnersDesc: Green Mongolia Hub (GMH) works closely with a range of national and local partners, including:
LocalPartners.gizDesc: Collaboration on sustainable land management and capacity building initiatives
LocalPartners.streamDesc: Partnership on water and rangeland resource management
LocalPartners.forestryDesc: Collaboration with local forestry units on afforestation and restoration projects
LocalPartners.soumDesc: Working with local administrations on community-based environmental initiatives
LocalPartners.activity1: Trainings on pasture and water resource management
LocalPartners.activity2: Meetings with herder groups, women's groups, and youth leaders
LocalPartners.activity3: Volunteer-based environmental stewardship and awareness campaigns
LocalPartners.keyActivitiesResult: This ensures that GMH's work is rooted in field realities and aligned with community needs and priorities.

PrivatePartners.title: Kubuqi Model Initiative
PrivatePartners.lead: Joint pilot Agrivoltaics project—combining agriculture and solar energy—in the Gobi region of Mongolia.
PrivatePartners.subtitle: "Kubuqi Model — advancing ecological restoration, industry development, and improved livelihoods"
PrivatePartners.kubuqiDesc: Kubuqi Desert (China, Inner Mongolia) has become a globally recognized model for combating desertification, reducing land degradation, and climate-resilient development through:
PrivatePartners.kubuqi3: Restored ~18,000 km² of degraded desert land
PrivatePartners.kubuqi4: Built 2,200 MW integrated solar & wind renewable energy system
PrivatePartners.ecologicalRestorationDesc: Reducing desertification, land degradation, and soil erosion. Restoring vegetation cover and maintaining ecosystem balance.
PrivatePartners.renewableEnergyDesc: Leveraging 2,200 MW of solar and wind power systems. Supporting irrigation systems, greenhouse farming, and animal husbandry.
PrivatePartners.communityEngagementDesc: Ensuring active participation of local communities. Creating employment and income-generating opportunities.
PrivatePartners.mainGoalDesc: To integrate solar energy solutions with ecological restoration in order to develop climate-resilient and adaptable local communities.
PrivatePartners.outcome1: Combat desertification and land degradation, while restoring and increasing vegetation cover
PrivatePartners.outcome3: Improve community livelihoods by supporting irrigation systems, greenhouse farming, and livestock production through renewable energy
PrivatePartners.outcome4: Power rural (agro) production and processing sectors with clean energy
PrivatePartners.projectImplementationDesc: Our project will be implemented in Mongolia's Gobi region, drawing on the proven approaches of the Kubuqi Model:
PrivatePartners.implementation1Desc: Combat desertification and land degradation. Restore vegetation cover and improve land productivity.
PrivatePartners.implementation2Desc: Introduce agrivoltaics (PV + agriculture). Clean energy solutions and efficient irrigation systems. Support climate-smart agriculture powered by renewable energy.
PrivatePartners.implementation3Desc: Community-based model engaging local farmers. Increase income opportunities. Create sustainable livelihoods.
PrivatePartners.pilotInitialDesc: 50–150 ha of land restoration + 1–5 MW Agro-PV system
PrivatePartners.pilotScaleDesc: Expansion to multiple sites with increased land restoration and solar capacity
PrivatePartners.pilotSuccess: If the pilot proves successful, it will be scaled into a national model, similar to the Kubuqi expansion pathway.
PrivatePartners.visionStatement: "Restore the Land • Empower Communities • Build a Legacy"
PrivatePartners.visionSubtitle: Building a replicable, climate-smart future for Mongolia's drylands.

Donate.title: Restore Land for Long-Term Impact
Donate.subtitle: Together, strengthening land, water, and ecosystem resilience in Mongolia.
Donate.whySupportDesc: Land restoration is essential to addressing desertification, drought, and climate risk. Through science-based and community-led approaches, Green Mongolia Hub supports sustainable land management, rangeland restoration, and nature-based solutions in areas most affected by land degradation.
Donate.whySupportDesc2: Your contribution helps advance evidence-based action aligned with UNCCD objectives, Mongolia's NDCs, and Vision 2030 priorities.
Donate.giveOnceDesc: Make a one-time donation to support our land restoration initiatives
Donate.giveMonthlyDesc: Set up a recurring monthly donation to provide sustained support
Donate.institutionalSupport: Interested in institutional or corporate support?
Donate.institutionalSupportDesc: Click here to partner with us on land restoration and climate resilience initiatives.
Donate.landRestorationDesc: Combat desertification and restore degraded lands
Donate.communityEmpowermentDesc: Support herders, women, and youth capacity building
Donate.climateResilienceDesc: Build resilience to drought and climate change

organizationalModel.title: Organizational Model
organizationalModel.description: Green Mongolia Hub operates through a core management unit supported by a flexible, project-based human resource model. This approach—commonly used by international technical assistance and UN-supported programmes—ensures transparency and accountability, cost efficiency, and access to high-quality national and international expertise.
organizationalModel.advantage3: Access to high-quality national and international expertise
organizationalModel.advantage4: Scalability according to project size and complexity

boardOfDirectors.title: Board of Directors
boardOfDirectors.description: The Board of Directors provides strategic leadership and oversight, with particular responsibility for:
boardOfDirectors.responsibility1: Guiding the organization's long-term vision and partnerships
boardOfDirectors.responsibility4: Supervising financial management and risk control
boardOfDirectors.responsibility5: Upholding transparency, integrity, and responsible organizational practices
boardOfDirectors.role: The Board plays a key role in maintaining Green Mongolia Hub's credibility and alignment with UN and donor standards.

managementCapacity.title: Management and Operational Capacity
managementCapacity.description: Green Mongolia Hub applies a lean core management structure combined with a project-based human resource model, widely used by UN agencies and international technical assistance programmes.
managementCapacity.ensure2: Scalability according to project size and complexity
managementCapacity.ensure3: Access to specialized expertise without long-term overheads
managementCapacity.coreUnitResponsibilities: The core management unit is responsible for:
managementCapacity.responsibility4: Compliance with contractual and fiduciary obligations

financialManagement.title: Financial Management and Procurement
financialManagement.description: Green Mongolia Hub applies transparent budgeting and financial reporting procedures:
financialManagement.point1: Outsources accounting and financial services to qualified professional providers
financialManagement.point2: Maintains clear documentation of expenditures, contracts, and deliverables
financialManagement.point3: Engages consultants and service providers through documented contracting processes appropriate to project requirements
financialManagement.point4: Ensures compliance with GEF and UNDP fiduciary expectations
financialManagement.compliance: These arrangements support compliance with GEF and UNDP fiduciary expectations and provide a foundation for further strengthening in line with GCF requirements as project scale increases.

technicalCapacity.title: Technical and Human Resource Capacity
technicalCapacity.description: Green Mongolia Hub mobilizes multidisciplinary expertise through contracted specialists and consultants, including:
technicalCapacity.specialist1: Sustainable Land Management (SLM) and WOCAT Technical Experts
technicalCapacity.specialist2: Rangeland Ecology and Pasture Restoration Specialists
technicalCapacity.specialist7: Social, Gender, and Community Engagement Specialists
technicalCapacity.approach: This approach ensures that project implementation is technically sound, context-specific, and aligned with international best practices.

mel.title: Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning (MEL)
mel.description: Green Mongolia Hub integrates Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning (MEL) into project design and implementation, with emphasis on:
mel.emphasis4: Alignment with UNCCD, LDN, and SLM indicators where applicable
mel.specialists: MEL specialists are engaged on a project basis to ensure methodological rigor and compliance with donor reporting requirements.

environmentalSocial.title: Environmental and Social Considerations
environmentalSocial.priority2: Participation of herders, women, youth, and local stakeholders
environmentalSocial.priority3: Alignment with principles of social inclusion and equity
environmentalSocial.integration: Environmental and social considerations are integrated into project planning and implementation in line with UNCCD, GEF, and UNDP good practice, with scope for further formalization as project scale and donor requirements evolve.

internationalAdvisory.title: International Advisory and Partnership Capacity
internationalAdvisory.description: Green Mongolia Hub is supported by a network of international advisers and technical experts who provide:
internationalAdvisory.provide1: Advisory input to project and programme design
internationalAdvisory.provide4: Alignment with international frameworks and methodologies
internationalAdvisory.strengthens: This strengthens institutional credibility and supports delivery of evidence-based, internationally aligned interventions.

institutionalPositioning.title: Institutional Positioning for Donor Engagement
institutionalPositioning.description: Through its governance framework, operational model, and international accreditation, Green Mongolia Hub is positioned to function as:
institutionalPositioning.position1: An implementing partner for UN agencies and donor-funded programmes
institutionalPositioning.position2: A technical and community interface for land restoration and LDN initiatives
institutionalPositioning.position3: A CSO partner supporting policy dialogue, field implementation, and knowledge exchange
institutionalPositioning.commitment: The organization remains committed to continuous institutional strengthening in line with evolving GEF, GCF, and UNDP capacity and fiduciary requirements.

GMHBoard.title: GMH Board
GMHBoard.introduction: Green Mongolia Hub NGO was established in 2024 as a legally registered civil society organization under the laws of Mongolia.
GMHBoard.accredited: Accredited to the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD)
GMHBoard.wocatMember: A member of the WOCAT Global Sustainable Land Management Network
GMHBoard.drynetMember: A member of the Drynet Network for Land Degradation Neutrality (LDN)
GMHBoard.membershipsDemonstrate: These memberships demonstrate alignment with UN-recognized technical frameworks, global knowledge platforms, and civil society coordination mechanisms relevant to GEF, GCF, and UNDP programming.

boardOfDirectors.title: Board of Directors (6 Members)
boardOfDirectors.description: The Board of Directors serves as the organization's highest governing and oversight body, with responsibility for:
boardOfDirectors.responsibility2: Oversight of international cooperation and partnerships
boardOfDirectors.responsibility3: Approval and supervision of programmes and projects
boardOfDirectors.responsibility4: Financial oversight, internal controls, and risk management
boardOfDirectors.responsibility5: Compliance with legal, fiduciary, and donor requirements
boardOfDirectors.separation: The Board ensures separation between governance and management functions, consistent with UNDP and GEF fiduciary standards.
boardOfDirectors.principles: The Board upholds principles of transparency, integrity, and accountability.

managementTeam.title: Management, Technical Team & Expertise
managementTeam.description: Green Mongolia Hub maintains a lean core team and scales its operations through contracted specialists, consultants, and volunteers according to project needs.
managementTeam.specialist1: Sustainable Land Management (SLM) and WOCAT Technical Experts
managementTeam.specialist2: Rangeland Ecology and Pasture Restoration Specialists
managementTeam.specialist7: Social, Gender, and Community Engagement Specialists

internationalSupport.title: International Expert Support
internationalSupport.description: Green Mongolia Hub is supported by a global network of senior advisers and technical experts who contribute to:
internationalSupport.enables: This governance and management structure enables Green Mongolia Hub to deliver credible, accountable, and impact-oriented interventions while remaining adaptable to evolving project and partnership needs.

CommitteesPanels.title: Committees, Panels & Groups
CommitteesPanels.description: Green Mongolia Hub maintains various committees, panels, and working groups to support its governance and operations. These structures ensure effective coordination, technical oversight, and community engagement across all organizational activities.

technicalWorkingGroups.title: Technical Working Groups
technicalWorkingGroups.description: Green Mongolia Hub participates in and establishes technical working groups to address specific thematic areas and prepare for major international events.
technicalWorkingGroups.cop17Description: As part of Mongolia's preparation for hosting UNCCD COP17 in 2026, Green Mongolia Hub participates in several technical sub-working groups:
technicalWorkingGroups.group1: Land Degradation Neutrality (LDN) implementation and monitoring
technicalWorkingGroups.group3: Sustainable land management and restoration practices
technicalWorkingGroups.nationalCarbonDesc: Green Mongolia Hub is a member of Mongolia's National Carbon Market Working Group, contributing expertise on land-based carbon solutions and sustainable land management approaches.

advisoryPanels.title: Advisory Panels
advisoryPanels.description: Advisory panels provide strategic guidance and technical expertise to support Green Mongolia Hub's mission and operations.
advisoryPanels.internationalAdvisoryDesc: A global network of senior advisers and technical experts provides guidance on project design, capacity development, technical supervision, and alignment with international best practices.
advisoryPanels.technicalExpertDesc: Specialized experts in sustainable land management, rangeland ecology, environmental research, and community engagement provide technical oversight and quality assurance for projects and programs.

projectCommittees.title: Project Committees
projectCommittees.description: Project-specific committees oversee implementation, ensure quality, and facilitate stakeholder engagement:
projectCommittees.committee1: Project Steering Committees - Provide strategic direction and oversight for major projects
projectCommittees.committee2: Technical Review Committees - Ensure technical quality and alignment with best practices
projectCommittees.committee3: Community Advisory Committees - Facilitate local community participation and feedback
projectCommittees.committee4: Monitoring and Evaluation Committees - Oversee MEL activities and learning processes

communityGroups.title: Community Engagement Groups
communityGroups.description: Green Mongolia Hub works closely with various community-based groups to ensure inclusive participation and local ownership:
communityGroups.type1: Herders' Associations - Representing pastoral communities and rangeland users
communityGroups.type2: Women's Groups - Ensuring gender-inclusive participation and empowerment
communityGroups.type3: Youth Groups - Engaging young people in environmental stewardship
communityGroups.type4: Local Cooperatives - Supporting community-based resource management
communityGroups.role: These groups play a crucial role in ensuring that Green Mongolia Hub's work is rooted in field realities and aligned with community needs and priorities.

PoliciesStrategies.title: Policies & Strategies
PoliciesStrategies.description: Green Mongolia Hub operates under a comprehensive set of policies and strategies aligned with international best practices and donor requirements. These frameworks ensure transparency, accountability, and effective program delivery.

financialPolicies.title: Financial Management Policies
financialPolicies.description: Green Mongolia Hub maintains robust financial management policies to ensure transparency, accountability, and compliance with donor requirements:
financialPolicies.policy1: Transparent budgeting and financial reporting procedures
financialPolicies.policy2: Outsourced accounting services to qualified professional providers
financialPolicies.policy3: Clear documentation of expenditures, contracts, and deliverables
financialPolicies.policy4: Documented contracting processes for consultants and service providers
financialPolicies.compliance: These policies ensure compliance with GEF, UNDP, and GCF fiduciary standards and provide a foundation for institutional strengthening.

environmentalSocialPolicies.title: Environmental and Social Policies
environmentalSocialPolicies.description: Green Mongolia Hub prioritizes environmental sustainability and social inclusion in all its activities:
environmentalSocialPolicies.principle1: Community-based approaches - Ensuring local ownership and participation
environmentalSocialPolicies.principle2: Inclusive participation - Engaging herders, women, youth, and vulnerable groups
environmentalSocialPolicies.principle3: Social equity - Promoting principles of social inclusion and equal access
environmentalSocialPolicies.principle4: Environmental protection - Integrating environmental considerations into all projects
environmentalSocialPolicies.alignment: These policies are aligned with UNCCD, GEF, and UNDP good practice and are continuously strengthened as project scale and donor requirements evolve.

strategicFramework.title: Strategic Framework
strategicFramework.description: Green Mongolia Hub's strategic framework guides organizational priorities and programmatic focus:
strategicFramework.priority1: Sustainable Land Management (SLM) - Localizing and implementing international best practices
strategicFramework.priority2: Land Restoration - Supporting degraded land rehabilitation and ecosystem recovery
strategicFramework.priority3: Capacity Building - Strengthening local communities, herders, women, and youth
strategicFramework.priority4: Policy Advocacy - Promoting Mongolia's good practices through global platforms

compliance.title: Compliance and Accountability
compliance.description: Green Mongolia Hub maintains strict compliance with legal, fiduciary, and donor requirements:
compliance.standard1: Legal compliance - Adherence to Mongolian laws and regulations
compliance.standard2: Fiduciary standards - Meeting UNDP and GEF financial accountability requirements
compliance.standard3: Donor requirements - Compliance with specific donor guidelines and reporting
compliance.standard4: International standards - Alignment with UNCCD, UNFCCC, and other relevant frameworks

qualityAssurance.title: Quality Assurance
qualityAssurance.description: Quality assurance measures ensure that all projects and programs meet high standards:
qualityAssurance.measure1: Technical review and supervision by qualified experts
qualityAssurance.measure2: Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning (MEL) integration throughout project lifecycle
qualityAssurance.measure3: Results-based management and documentation of field-level outcomes
qualityAssurance.measure4: Alignment with international best practices and methodologies

GMHProgramsProjects.title: GMH Programs & Projects
GMHProgramsProjects.subTitle: Our Portfolio
GMHProgramsProjects.description: Green Mongolia Hub implements a diverse portfolio of programs and projects focused on sustainable land management, capacity building, climate technologies, and climate finance.

ongoingProjects.title: Ongoing Projects
ongoingProjects.description: Currently active projects that are being implemented across Mongolia.

completedProjects.title: Completed Projects
completedProjects.description: Successfully completed projects that have made significant contributions to land restoration and community development.

capacityBuilding.title: Capacity Building Activities
capacityBuilding.description: Training and capacity building programs for local communities, herders, women, and youth.

climateTechnologies.title: Climate Technologies
climateTechnologies.description: Innovative climate technologies and solutions for sustainable land management and environmental protection.

climateFinance.title: Climate Finance
climateFinance.description: Climate finance initiatives and funding mechanisms to support sustainable land management projects.

GMHInitiatives.title: GMH Initiatives
GMHInitiatives.subTitle: Innovative Solutions
GMHInitiatives.subtitle: Innovative projects combining ecological restoration with renewable energy solutions

agrivoltaics.title: Agrivoltaics Project
agrivoltaics.description: An innovative project combining agriculture and solar energy in the Gobi region of Mongolia, inspired by the Kubuqi Model.

goal.title: Goal & Vision
goal.description: To integrate solar energy solutions with ecological restoration in order to develop climate-resilient and adaptable local communities.

outcomes.title: Expected Outcomes
outcomes.outcome1: Combat desertification and land degradation, while restoring and increasing vegetation cover
outcomes.outcome3: Improve community livelihoods by supporting irrigation systems, greenhouse farming, and livestock production through renewable energy
outcomes.outcome4: Power rural (agro) production and processing sectors with clean energy

kubuqiModel.title: The Kubuqi Model
kubuqiModel.description: A globally recognized model integrating ecological restoration, green industry, and resilient community livelihoods through renewable energy innovation.

achievements.energyDesc: Integrated solar & wind renewable energy system

pillar1.title: Ecological Restoration & Environmental Protection
pillar1.desc1: Reducing desertification, land degradation, and soil erosion
pillar1.desc2: Restoring vegetation cover and maintaining ecosystem balance

pillar2.title: Renewable Energy & Green Economy
pillar2.desc1: Leveraging 2,200 MW of solar and wind power systems
pillar2.desc2: Supporting the development of irrigation systems, greenhouse farming, and animal husbandry
pillar2.desc3: Driving sustainable economic growth in the region

pillar3.title: Community Engagement & Livelihood Improvement
pillar3.desc1: Ensuring active participation of local communities

summary.title: Kubuqi Ecological Climate Restoration
summary.description: A combined model of ecological restoration, industry, and people's livelihoods.

initial.title: Initial Phase
initial.description: 50–150 ha of land restoration + 1–5 MW Agro-PV system. Prototype demonstration site in the Gobi region.

scaleUp.title: Scale-Up Phase
scaleUp.description: Expansion to multiple sites with increased land restoration and solar capacity. If the pilot proves successful, it will be scaled into a national model, similar to the Kubuqi expansion pathway.

vision.title: Building a Replicable Future
vision.description: Restore the Land • Empower Communities • Build a Legacy - Building a replicable, climate-smart future for Mongolia's drylands.

NationalProgramsProjects.title: National Programs & Projects
NationalProgramsProjects.subTitle: National Collaboration
NationalProgramsProjects.description: Collaborative programs and projects implemented in partnership with national and local institutions across Mongolia.

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: Green Mongolia Hub works closely with national partners including GIZ Mongolia, STREAM+ program, forestry units, and local administrations to implement sustainable land management initiatives.

vision2030.title: Vision 2030 Framework
vision2030.description: Mongolia's national programmes are guided by Vision 2030, the country's long-term development policy framework, which emphasizes environmental sustainability, climate resilience, responsible natural resource management, and inclusive economic growth.
vision2030.framework: Vision 2030 provides the long-term policy direction for sustainable land, water, and ecosystem management.
vision2030.billionTreesDesc: Through Vision 2030 and the One Billion Trees initiative, Mongolia positions land restoration and sustainable land management not as stand-alone activities, but as long-term, nationally anchored processes that integrate land restoration, sustainable land management, afforestation, and agroforestry.
vision2030.alignment: Green Mongolia Hub's work aligns with Vision 2030 priorities, UNCCD commitments, and Mongolia's NDC 3 objectives, contributing to reducing land degradation, drought, and climate risks while strengthening rangeland and water security through community-based approaches.

area1.title: Rangeland & Water Resource Management
area1.description: Training programs focused on sustainable rangeland and water resource management practices.

area2.title: Community Engagement
area2.description: Meetings and consultations with herder groups, women's groups, and youth leaders to ensure local participation.

area3.title: Environmental Protection
area3.description: Volunteer-based environmental protection activities, environmental education, and impact assessments.

area4.title: Field-Based Implementation
area4.description: All activities are grounded in real field conditions and aligned with local community needs and priorities.

partners.title: Key Partners
partners.description: Green Mongolia Hub collaborates with diverse national and local partners:

UNProgramsProjects.title: UN Programs & Projects
UNProgramsProjects.subTitle: International Partnerships
UNProgramsProjects.description: Programs and projects implemented in partnership with United Nations agencies and international organizations.

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: Green Mongolia Hub is accredited to the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD) and collaborates with various UN agencies and international networks.

partnership1.title: UNCCD Accreditation
partnership1.description: Accredited civil society organization under the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification, enabling participation in global policy processes.

partnership2.title: WOCAT Network
partnership2.description: Official Regional cluster member of WOCAT, the global network endorsed by UNCCD, providing access to over 2,400 sustainable land management practices.

partnership3.title: Drynet Network
partnership3.description: Member of the Drynet Network for Land Degradation Neutrality (LDN), promoting best practices in land restoration.

partnership4.title: COP17 Hosting
partnership4.description: Supporting the organization of COP17 in Ulaanbaatar in August 2026, bringing together 15,000+ delegates from 197+ countries.

activity1.title: Best Practice Documentation
activity1.description: Localizing, field implementing, and documenting international SLM best practices, particularly from WOCAT.

activity2.title: Capacity Building
activity2.description: Training, hands-on demonstrations, and participatory monitoring for local communities, herders, women, and youth.

activity3.title: Multi-Stakeholder Cooperation
activity3.description: Supporting cooperation in land restoration, ecosystem protection, and rangeland management.

activity4.title: Global Platform Engagement
activity4.description: Promoting Mongolia's good practices through global platforms such as UNCCD, WOCAT, and Drynet.

impact.title: Impact
impact.description: Through these partnerships and activities, Green Mongolia Hub contributes to global efforts in combating desertification, promoting sustainable land management, and building climate resilience in Mongolia and beyond.

Footer.description: Green Mongolia Hub NGO was established in 2024 as a legally registered civil society organization under the laws of Mongolia. The organization is accredited to the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD) and is a member of both the WOCAT Global SLM Network and the Drynet Network for Land Degradation Neutrality (LDN).

GMHDataResources.title: GMH Data & Resources
GMHDataResources.description: Access to global knowledge platforms and databases for sustainable land management practices and best practices.

platforms.title: Knowledge Platforms
platforms.description: Green Mongolia Hub provides access to leading global knowledge platforms and databases for sustainable land management.

platform1.title: WOCAT Global SLM Database
platform1.description: Access to over 2,400 sustainable land management practices and technologies from around the world.

platform2.title: UNCCD Knowledge Platform
platform2.description: Integration with UNCCD knowledge resources and best practices for combating desertification.

platform3.title: Drynet Network Resources
platform3.description: Access to Land Degradation Neutrality (LDN) resources and community engagement methodologies.

benefit1.title: Comprehensive Knowledge Base
benefit1.description: Access to thousands of documented SLM practices and technologies from global experts.

benefit2.title: Local Application
benefit2.description: Tools and resources adapted for Mongolian conditions and field implementation.

benefit3.title: Continuous Updates
benefit3.description: Regular updates with new practices, methodologies, and case studies from around the world.

GMHPublications.title: GMH Publications
GMHPublications.description: Documentation and registration of field experiences, best practices, and project outcomes in global knowledge databases.

publication1.title: WOCAT Database Registration
publication1.description: Field experiences documented and registered in WOCAT global SLM knowledge database.

publication2.title: Project Documentation
publication2.description: Comprehensive documentation of shelterbelt establishment, nurseries, and protection zones.

publication3.title: Best Practices Reports
publication3.description: Reports on successful SLM practices implemented in Mongolia.

publication4.title: Case Studies
publication4.description: Detailed case studies of field projects and their outcomes.

benefit1.title: Global Recognition
benefit1.description: Mongolian practices recognized and shared on international platforms.

benefit2.title: Knowledge Sharing
benefit2.description: Contributing to global knowledge base while learning from others.

benefit3.title: Documentation Standards
benefit3.description: Following international documentation standards for quality and credibility.

GMHToolsMethods.title: GMH Tools & Methods
GMHToolsMethods.description: WOCAT assessment and documentation tools, evaluation systems, and methodologies for sustainable land management.

tool1.title: WOCAT Assessment Tools
tool1.description: Evaluation and documentation tools for assessing sustainable land management practices at local levels.

tool2.title: WOCAT Documentation Tools
tool2.description: Tools for documenting field experiences, best practices, and project outcomes.

tool3.title: PRAIS & LDN Indicators
tool3.description: Support for using tools such as WOCAT, PRAIS, and LDN indicators for land degradation assessment.

methods.method1: Localization of WOCAT methodologies in Mongolia
methods.method2: Application of assessment tools at soum and community levels
methods.method3: Documentation and registration in global databases
methods.method4: Training and capacity building on tool usage
